intro: Georgina scapigera, commonly known as the slender garden bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
